statement.tex: %text If $f(x) = x + 7$ and $g(x) = x-7, x\in\mathbb{R},$ then find $(f\circ g)(7)$ %

options.tex:
%text
\[(f\circ g)(x) = f\left( g\left( x\right)\right) \]
\incorrect \[(f\circ g)(x) = f(x)\cdot g(x) \] %

reason.tex: %text $(f\circ g)(x)$ is simply shorthand for $ f\left( g\left( x\right)\right)$. And similarly $\left(g\circ f \right)(x) = g \left( f \left(x \right) \right)$ And note that $ f \left(g(x) \right)\neq g \left(f(x) \right)$%
